text: From old tasting notes. Cloudy gold color. Big rocky off-white head. Fruity citrus malt aroma. Bittersweet malt flavor with notes of lemon peel. Intense bitter finish and aftertaste. From start to finish, there is a dramatic contrast in the texture of flavors. All in all, the citrus overtones are dominant. Notes of lemon, orange and grapefruit. Very good.

Bottle. Hazy Yellow Gold. Very, very hoppy beer. Grassy, flowery, spicy hops. Very intense bitterness. Bitter grapefruit/lemon citrus. Astringent. Herbal. Underlying malt (buttery, caramelly). Increasingly bitter towards dry lingering finish. Definitely one for hopheads. Liked it! (2008)

From a pals euro trip. Had tight after green ghost from creature comforts and greatly preferred that one. This has light spicy hops, grain, and a touch of sweet and bitter. Its quality but didnt really do anything to standout.

Barwa złota, z delikatną mgiełką, dwu centymetrową, biała piana, nie jest trwała.
Aromat słodowy, miodowy ze słodkim bananem w tle, z nutami cytryny, limonki.
Smak podobnie jak wcześniej słodowość miesza się z nutami owocowymi a całość sprawia wrażenie idealnie wyważonej.
Finisz to już tylko goryczka. Nie jest może imponująco wysoka (IBU 45) ale za to jest niesamowicie intensywna. Sucha, nieco trawiasta, grapefruitowa
Wysycenie wysokie.
A very nice plisner. One of the best Ive tasted ever. Has a nice bitterness, without tending to an ipa taste. Unfiltered. Fortunately its widely available in Holland. Excellent exemple of a pils.

Bottle 33cl
@ Cerveceria Internacional, Sevilla, Spain.
A: Golden.
T: Malt, yeast, citrusy, fruity.
Bottle a golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts citrus fruits spicy and hops flavor malts citrus fruits spicy yeast and hops

Bottle 33cl, a cloudy golden beer with good white creamy head, nose is a bit on exotic fruits and yeast. Aroma is on grain, crisp, floral and orange like hops, medium bitterness and sweetness, like the unfiltered side in pilsner.

Bottle courtesy of Deanso. Poured a crystal clear straw colour with a frothy white head and plenty of bubbles. The aroma is medicinal, alcohol malt. Rather like a malt liqour but without the alcohol. The flavour is moderate sweet, light bitter with a big malt, yeast, aromatic hop bitter palate. Medium bodied with lively carbonation.
Solid pilsnener. Fairly bitter, especially for a pilsnener. Slightly grassy aroma, fuzzy.

Ich hatte diesen Leckerbissen hier auch als Christoffel Blond. Wunderbar einfach zu trinken mit einer ausgewogenen Note an herben und hopfigen Momenten nebst einer leichten Blumigkeit, die stark an Belgien und dessen Hopfen und Hefe erinnert. Gut in der Perlung, süffig, vollkommen in Ordnung. Gerne noch ein zweites.

33cl bottle, labeled as Christoffer Blond. Clear pale golden, with a tall, fine-grained white head with good retention. Smells like pilsner hops, honey, malt sugars and some generic hops. Bitter-sweet and as far away from a pilsener as I ever had, crisp and refreshing, with notes of bitter hops, honey, green hops and sugar. A bit spicy in the aftertaste. Very nice.
Nice floral aroma. Solid body with a slight bitterness at the end. Not bad for a pils
Draught. Hoppy, floral aroma, light body, hoppy floral flavour, with a bitter finish

Čapované v Beer Time Nitra. Príjemná chmeľová aróma s citrusovým nádychom, zlatá farba, biela pena. Plná chuť, na začiatok stredne sladová kvetinová chuť, koniec chmelený, horkosť s citrusmi. Výborné pivo.

0.33 l bottle from Van Bieren as St Christoffel Blond at 5.4% abv, best before October 2017 (so five months old I guess). Minimally hazy, straw yellow with a medium large, foamy, stable, white head. Fruity-grassy, slightly floral aroma of lemon peel, fresh cut grass and some grapefruit. Sweetish, already slightly bitter, fruity-floral, moderately grassy taste of lemon peel, grapefruit, some honey and straw, followed by medium long, dry-bitter and grassy finish. Thin to medium body, smooth and slightly effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Very fruity and refreshing, reveals again how nice unfiltered Lagers can be.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2016

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, corn syrup, yeast, fruit, grain, hops and citrus.

Appearance:

Turbid yellow/golden amber beer with a slight/medium white/off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel, corn syrup, yeast and fruit; ends slightly bitter and dry with grain, hops and citrus.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. Amazing balance with all the flavours you would expect in a quality Pilsener. Could have benefited from some fruitier hops, but that is about it. The great appearance and palate are definitely the highlight.
Dit is een zeer verfrissend blond biertje met zeer veel smaak eraan. Drinkt gemakkelijk weg en is best lekker.

Slightly hazy and yella. Lots of carbonation. Nice fresh wet hop aroma. Bitter piney hops. Shame they dont just call it a pils, cause it really is a good one. Drying bitter finish with almost a rye maltiness to it. Long lasting. Probably the most bitter pils Ive ever had, but not over the top. I preferred the old label, but at least the beers still good.
5 Dec 2015, bottle. brown. nose is sweet, bready, mildly toasty. med/thin and mildly fizzy. really dark chocolate, malty, meaty. ok.
Thuis, fles, gedeeld met Mrk. Hoppy kruidig blondje beetje milky. Backlog from 2015/08/01.
Flaske. Ufiltreret lys gykldengul i farven med en hvid skumkrone. Aromaen er gær og humle, og smagen er græs og humle. Man anvender her - ligesom Vends Herred Årgangsbryg - friskplukket humle.

330 ml. bottle. BBF 10/07/2017. Clear oily golden, little white bubbles, small. Noise is oily, vegetable, corn with big floral hop profile, herbal, grains. Taste is sweet cereal, grains, honey, very oily, big floral & weed bitterness, weeds, strong bitterness, caramel, cornflakes, Lingering hop profile. Complimentary sparkling cereal & grains body. Dry. Interesting, you need to get a bit into it. The best way I can describe this one is by saying that it is like pale lager but good. No flaws, rich, big hops but still comparable elements just none of the flaws or usual awful notes. Very big hops. Interesting.

Bottle from Sterk in Amsterdam. Pours hazy gold with a white head. Aroma of light stone fruit and mild, pale malt. Med body, but the carbonation level helps with that. The flavor is spicy, fresh stone fruit with some pale malt which provides adequate support for the fairly strong hop load. Granted its bottom fermented, but it drinks like Belgian Ale. Calling it California Common would seem a bit odd, but it does suggest a spicy Anchor Steam. Good stuff in any case.Earlier Rating: 6/3/2008 Total Score: 3.4Tap at t Arendsnest. Hazy orange gold color with a creamy white head. Light stone fruit aroma with a hint of citrus. Rather bitter and fruity flavor. Something of citrus rind. Finishes nicely bitter. Refreshing.
Gold appearance with white head and slight aroma. Light taste with a hint of fruity hops. No aftertaste. Very light and refreshing.

Pajiza, amarillenta turbia, con dos dedos de espuma. Aroma interesante, citrico principalmente. Se trata de una lager con doble lupulo y algo mas de alcohol para una pilsen. Sobre todo destaca lo primero, muy aromatica, citrica y frutal y amarga. Buena carbonatacion y agradable textura. Merece.

330ml Bottle in Café De Spuyt, Amsterdam (5.50):
A very nice pilsner that went down quite nicely. The beer had an excellent balance with a solid fruity backing & plenty of flavours to keep you interested as well as remaining refreshing & easy to drink throughout. There was definitely more hops than I was expecting & the finish was quite a dry one but overall the beer was very good & well worth trying.

Appearance: Light hazy golden color with a fine white head. Ok lacing.Aroma: Caramel malty, citric, some yeast and mild herbal.Palate: Medium + body. Tad sweet and a fine bitterness. Average carbonation.Taste: Caramel malty, some yeast, mild spices and a bit citric hoppy.Overall impression: If all pilsner where like this..Personal stats: Bottle from Berts Bierhuis in Utrecht, Netherlands

Flasche (33 cl) von Bierlieb, Berlin. - Orangegelb, schön trüb mit reichlich Schaum, der sich lange hält und schöne Ringe im Glas hinterläßt. - In der Nase reiche Hopfennoten, die an tropische Frucht erinnern. - Im Antrunk scharf grasiger und kräftig herb-zitrusfruchtiger Hopfen: Zitronenschale, Harz, Basilikum. Trotz der heftigen Hopfenattacke ist noch Platz für eine weiche Malzsüße. Durchschnittlich rezent, vollmundig, weich im Mund. Der etwas höhere Alkoholgehalts verleiht diesem Bier eine spürbare Schwere, die die Aromenfülle unterstreicht. Im Abgang kräftige Bittere mit Zitronenschale, Nadelwald und Harz. Sehr langer, bitterer Nachtrunk. - Wuchtig und sehr aromatisch gehopftes Bier. Kein typisches Pilsener, aber ein Hochgenuß.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2015 Meest neigend naar pils, maar subtiel op alle vlakken. Mooi granen, steenfruit en gras in aroma, prima prikkelende bitters en mondgevoel in balans. Kraag staat fier overeind, dik en vettig. Verfijnde tussendoor als het wat lichter kan of mag.
 #2 lichte verse kruiden, geldstukken en wat citrus in aroma. Smaak is bitter met zuur met frisse elementen. Nasmaak blijft bitter. Palate min1

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2015 Wahouuuuh!!! tremendous!
Unfiltered and solid head. Pretty malty aroma with some yeast in it. There is a nice bitterness. Just excellent!!
The head is ok, the body blond, a bit cloudy. It smells malty, bottomfermented, dry, fresh, bit hoppy. The taste is yeasty-dry, hoppy, nice malty. Pretty good for a Pilsener!

Bottle 33cl. Hazy yellow with a white head. Yeasty nose and some buxus. A bit like a pilsner. Nice full body with a good portion of hops. Quite long bitter finish. Much better flavour than in the nose.

Bottle shared at a tasting in Dancing Camel Florentin. Thanks vipinvelp for the bottle! Hazy blond with white film. A little grainy, slightly caramel aroma, sweet with wet grain taste, rather light-bodied, faint malty finish.

BOTTLE 33 CL from Douberd.

Look: hazy straw-yellow, beautiful white creamy head.
Aroma: solid German flowery and lemony hops, some malt/honey sweetness.
Taste: solid body (maybe to full for a pils - or is it?), pretty sweet with a strong aromatic bitterness and long very bitter finish. Some faint alcoholic/solvent notes showing through. Very good otherwise.

Barwa: złota, wyraźnie zamglona. Piana białą, drobno pęcherzykowa, gęsta i obfita.

Aromat: słodowy (zbożowo- herbatnikowy), z wyraźnym akcentem chmielowym (owocowo - ziołowym). Alkohol niewyczuwalny, jest natomiast lekka nuta maślana. 

Smak: słodowy, dość pełny i początkowo słodki, niestety także lekko maślany. Do tego konkretna, chmielowa kontra z wyraźną goryczką w okolicach średniej (nieco zalegającą) oraz lekko alkoholową końcówką. 

Piwo z książki "1001 piw, które warto spróbować". Tym razem propozycja holenderska, która od momentu bankructwa browaru w 20013r. jest warzona w Belgii. Nie wiem, jak smakowała uprzednio, ale obecnie nie jest niczym nadzwyczajnym. Jeśli wierzyć przekazom, w porównaniu do wersji oryginalnej goryczka została zwiększona o 7 punktów do 50 ibu, zatem jak na ten styl sporo. Niestety poz tym nie oferuje nic ciekawego. Za tą cenę z pewnością nie warto.
Blond with average top. Wall sticking foam. Strong hop flavor which overshadow the rest.

Tasted both in its original form and the new Proefbrouwerij version. Unusual, unfiltered Pilsener brewed according to the Reinheitsgebot, with a frothy, snow white, sticky head and deep old gold colour. Elegant aroma of pure pale malts and herbal, complex hoppiness; taste begins softly malty, fruity, then moving quickly towards quite strong, aromatic and herbal hop bitterness. A classic and a good candidate for the honorary title of "best Dutch lager".

Not sure about the alias???? A Dubbel is not the same as a blond or pilsner. That being said. Hazy light brown pour with minimal head. Chocolate aroma. Thick tasting. Smooth and full bodied but still drinkable. Nice finish. Enjoyable.

Bottle 33cl. Somewhat hazy yellow with a nice white top. Not sure if this alias does justice because it tastes more like pilsner than blonde beer. A very good pilsner though, but the double hopped leaves just a bit too much bitterness in the aftertaste. Still a very nice beer.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2014 Bottle. Clear yellow/gold, frothy head, little lighter then most Pilsners. Aroma is normal Pilsner, bitterness from the hops, but somehow very well balanced (it definitely is not an "in your face" bitter kick). Some light touches of dried citrus, seawater (salty). Taste...wow. This is one nice lager. Taste starts with sweet grains infused with dried citrus and pine. Slowly evolves to a very agreeable bitterness, previous tastes slowly fade (but never completely). In following sips the dried citrus taste moves more towards exotic fruits, lychee even (though it definitely is not an ipa). Turns a bit salty at the end. Great stuff.

Bottle from old backlog notes 07. Pours a hazy golden color with a medium sized white head. The aroma and flavor have pilsner malts, grass, noble hop, floral, light yeasty bread, not bad, this is just a sstyle that I dont enjoy very much.

33cl bottle @ home from Mitra. Slightly hazy yellow golden color, medium white head. Aroma totally commercial pilsener lager in the nose, flavor is a bit yeasty and more hoppy than a usual pilsener. Taste light sweetness, light to medium bitterness, hint of sourness, slightly acidic. Light to medium body, slightly creamy texture, average carbonation, more bitter finish than an average pilsener. Not a big deal, just a good lager.
Trübes goldenes Bier mit ordentlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch hopfig, fruchtig, Citrus, grasig, so ist auch der Geschmack.
UPDATED: DEC 5, 2015 Aroma of bready malts, fruits, yeast, hops. Flavour is malty, some sweetness, more hops, with a nice bitter finish. If this is a Pilsener, its one of my favourites.
Bottle at home. Pours a hazy golden with a white head. Bit of an earthy aroma of malts and fruity hops. Taste is also a bit earthy with hoppy bitterness. Nice bitter aftertaste. Quite nice.

33 cl bottle. Fresh flower parfumed hops, bread. Clear golden colour with white head. Tiny head lasting. Little yeasty taste. Medium sweet, medium bitterness. Little nutty. Bitter finish. Dry, watery body. Average carbonation.

33cl bottle at home. Hazy orange with a medium soapy white head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Hoppy bitterness with some sweet notes. Citrus, grass, malts, hops and herbs. A decent tastefull brew.
Heldere lichte kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt hop, kruiden, iets bitter. Smaakt lekker bitter, kruiden rn iets fruitig.
2010 bottle. Pours a golden slightly unclear beer with a good white head. Smells hops and floral. Tastes insane. Nice bitter, hops and silky. Average carbo, thin body and a dry texture.
Not my kind of beer. Way too hoppy finish for me. If you like those kinds of beer, this is a good one for you.
Wouldnt actually call this pilsner, although this is not clearly a blond beer either. Quite amusing beer.
33cl swing top bottle, older bottle brewed in the old brewery, darker golden beer with a small white head, aroma of malts, taste is nothing special, drinkable but not great.

bread, honey, dough, grass, candy sugar, hazy golden, nice frothy white head, vanishes after a while, some lacing, taste slightly sweet, dry and medium bitter, creamy texture, medium body, flat, full fresh dry bitter finish

Tap at Provisions Market in Orange, CA. Lower carbonation on low haze golden pour. Spotty foam. Intense jasmine honey aroma. Honey pot. Taste is apple and very papery. Not fresh tasting. Uhh. Huskier. Sad.

Tap: hazy golden with medium-sized whit head. Aroma is grassy with toasted cracker and a bit of candy sugar and honey. Flavor is surprisingly dry and mostly bitter with grass, bisquit, some yeast and just a touch of honey. Interesting flavor, I would drink more, just not often.
Not that special, but considering its a pilsner yet impressive. Shame that the bewery went bankrupt.

Si presenta particolarmente opaca e sormontata da una compatta schiuma candida. il corpo alcolico ma leggero da bassa fermentazione si bilancia in maniera ottima con la luppolatura intensa e aromatica. Davvero buona.
Hazy golden appearance, medium low head, malty and fruity aroma, bitter hoppy finnish.
330 ml swing top bottle. Pours a tawny color with light head. Aromas of marzipan, dried apricots, and malts. Flavors of resin, bitter hops, and spice. An "Imperial" Pils, but not much to my liking.

Hazy gold with a lasting, white, lacy, sticky head. Looks like a golden ale. Smells of hops and grass with fruits, corn, elderflower, yeast, and some wet cardboard. Medium oily body with medium carbonation. Tastes of corn and lemon with an earthy hop and finishes with pine and grass. A bit grassy for my taste with a bit of wet cardboard. It was refreshing enough but not something I would suggest.
This is a really nice, alcoholic take on the style.  I dont know how much I agree with the pilsener designation, as it has some pretty complex herbal and spice notes.  Very good though.

Head: some white foam. Colour: clear, yellow. Aroma: hops. Taste: bitter. Palate: medium bitter finish, watery. Overall: ok.
Fra fat på Enka en varm julikveld med Kitty i 2010: enda en av disse fruktige, crispy belgiere som skal prøves igjen til sommeren - Belgia here we come!
Pretty good pils with no real adjunt flavors.  Light and crisp with the spicy hops I expect out of a pilsener without the off light malts I often get.  Pretty good.
On draft at propig, charming and malty. A strong malty body, plisnery malts, yeasty

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2013 Hazy golden beer with off-white head. Smell is mainly sour & hop. Taste is more interesting. It has a quite bitter hoppy, bready, herbal and spicy flavor profile. Its the finish thats making this one special. The hop bitter mellows out quicker then youd expect when all the flavors seem to balance out better in a medium dry finish with soms citrus fruits as well. Developing back into the bitter hop flavor making the next sip another flavor sensation. Nice beer. Great? Hm ... not sure. Im  a bit fed up with the Saaz / Citra hop bitters many beers seem to favor nowadays.

troebel gouden met schuimig witte kraag
aroma: koriander, citrus, grapefruit, fruit, gras
smaken: peper, citrus, graan, koriander, redelijk moutig
medium zoet, medium/zwaar bitter, licht zuur, licht/medium body, normale co2.
afdronk: lang bitter en kruidig.
indruk: stevig bier maar ik zal het niet gaan missen!
Bottled 0,33L. Golden bubbly color, discreet head resistance. Intense malty aroma with decided alcoholic notes. Rough and crisp body, pleasant bitter taste with a bitter and little washed out final.
Slightly hazy golden yellow with lasting and lacing white foam head. Aroma is light hoppy, mostly barley. Taste is nice bitter, with slight floral notes. Nice aftertate, good beer. (Velp 201301)

Brown swing top bottle of 330 ml, poured into a footed pilsner glass. ABV is 6%. Beer is unfiltered and unpasteurized.

First time I see such a pilsner. Yellow colour, very hazy body. Nice two fingers in height, white and soapy head. Good retention.
Lots of the Saaz hops on the aroma, some bread maltiness too.
Wow, taste is amazing! Is this really a pilsner, I ask again? Just an initial sweetness on the tip of the tongue and then is bitterness and hops all the way! A light apple taste somewhere in the middle.
Medium body, average carbonation and a very dry and long finish.
What a surprise this was! Definitely worth every penny, will keep it in mind.

Unfiltered and solid head. That its called a pilsner doesnt do it justice. I think the Dutch make really interesting beer with one foot in Belgian tradition and one in the new experimental American style. Christoffels beers are however a bit more old fashioned in their approach. This bottle is slightly old but Ive had this beer before. Pretty malty aroma with some yeast in it. There is a nice bitterness but it has more depth in it than just that. Not the best in the world but very drinkable and not too difficult. Also works nicely with food as it doesnt overwhelm. Also a lot more subtle in its style compared to a lot of new beer, which can actually be refreshing after a while. Bier/blonde is just excellent when its totally fresh. Will have again and would be really nice to have totally fresh. It has more body and the head is creamier then.

Grosse bouteille blanche surnommée "The Big Dutch" avec la bière sous le nom de "Christoffel Blond". De couleur dorée et voilée. Nez de houblon floral, herbeux et aux faibles notes citriques, de pain, léger de caramel très doux avec des notes mielleuses, fruitées (agrumes) et de grains de céréales. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture légèrement crémeuse. Goût légèrement fruité (agrumes sucrées) et aux petties notes épicées (poivre très doux) avec une moyenne-légère amertume de houblon floral aux faibles notes citriques et résineuses (une amertume qui dure toute la gorgée) ainsi quun léger goût de grains de malt pâle lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un goût de malt légèrement sucré de caramel très doux contenant des notes de miel et de pain puis en finale lamertume de houblon prend une tournure légèrement plus herbeuse. Post-goût moyen-long et légèrement sec, moyen-léger amer de houblon floral et herbeux et avec des notes fruitées (zeste dagrumes).
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours cloudy golden with a white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma is malt, yeast, and citrus. Flavour is citrus, malt, and yeast  with a dry finish.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2013 Bottled. Pours slightly hazy and golden with a small white head. Nose of yeast, grass, caramel and citrus notes. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and decent bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft CO2. A pleasant and balanced beer. ★★★
Blonde color, white head.  Grassy hops, some light fruity notes and caramel with a yeasty finish.  Not bad not amazing.

33cl swing-top bottle, 2.75. Look: Hazy yellow colour, unfiltered, nice creamy white head. Hoppy nose, hmmm! Aroma is prominently hops, with bitter orange peel. Is this a pilsener? More similar to a soft IPA to me... It has an american hop feel in the beginning, then the saaz remain on the tongue. Malts seems a bit subdued, less bready than others, still being smooth. However, aroma focus on the grassy notes, possibly a remain of yeast. Alcohol hardly noticeable. Taste, again, hops does a major role. Minimal initial sweetness and an exciting bitter bite, good and not excessive. Finish is quite long and hoppy, bitter, soft. Body is medium, low carbonation. Overall an unexpected nice surprise, very good when a hoppy one is desired. Price over the average, but hard to find and absolutely worth. Somewhat similar to Urthel Saisonnière.

Bottle. A high-rated pilsener from the Netherlands? Definitely worth checking out. Pours a hazy, honey-hued orange body with a tiny white head. Nose is pale malts, grass, honey, hints of straw, peaches and caramel. Nice and very well integrated. Taste is grains, honey, cereals, hints of bitter grass and heather in the finish. Nice and mellow. Slick mouthfeel, medium to full body. Definitely a different kinda pilsener, and pretty good too. But at 6 % ABV, Im starting to doubt the categorization here...

33ck Flip-top bottle taken at Cafe de Grendelpoort, Valkenburg during a stay over in Oct 2012.

The beer pours a cloudy/hazy orange colour: on top a white covering of thick foam, which stayed for the whole tasting.

The nose was yeasty and hoppy with a strong fruitiness to the fore, a semi-sour citrusy smell became more apparant as the beer warmed in the glass.

Taste wise it was a pleasant blend of hops and malts, each around the same in their strength of flavour. So, well balanced and neither sweet or dry. Refreshing and easy to drink with enough hop bite to excite and plenty of malty sweetness to counteract those bittering hops.

The alcohol sits nicely within the brew and is just about noticed in the mouth feel, wouldnt want it any stronger.

Tasting various beers with friends. Summary for this bottle: Cloudy with small head. Full fresh citron/lemon smell. Taste of attick and heavy bitterness, probably that is the heavy hop used. It was not appreciated.
hazy in appearance, yeasty aroma, quite bitter with a fine long bitter finish. feels quite strong.
Blond, goede kraag die vrij snel wegzakt tot een laagje op het bier. Ruikt  bitterhoppig en een beetje fruitig. Smaakt  idem. Goede nasmaak, medium body.

#952
 Ersmabin ich mir nicht sicher, ob das hier wirklich ein echtes Pils ist!??
"Christoffel Bier" steht auf dem Etikett; nix mit Pils...Der Vermerk "dubbel gehopt" weist zwar in diese Richtung, aber im Glas habe ich beileibe kein Pilsener. Sieht vielmehr recht dunkel aus in Richtung orange und dazu noch ziemlich trüb. Im Aroma eher süßlich-sauer, merkwürdig. Im Antrunk auch eher malzig und die 6,0% Alk. schlagen unangenehm durch. Im Abgang kommt dann eine ziemlich strenge Herbheit, die das bisherige Geschmackserlebnis ziemlich auf den Kopf stellt. Für mich viel zu unausgewogen und auch nicht wirklich bekömmlich; der Schädelfaktor ist ausgesprochen hoch. Zum Glück hab ich kein Verlangen nach einem weiteren Glas Christoffel, Schutzpatron der Flodders ;)
	
Test vom 11.2.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 7,7,6,6,9,7 - 6,80

pours cloudy orangish/brown (unfiltered) with a smallish head, micro CO2, lots of slow moving CO2 streams. Clean yeasty malts on the nose. Drinks with silky creamy CO2 up front, flavours of sweet bread, medium malts, light toffee, and then the medium-bitter sharp hops kick in until the yeasty finish. Medium complexity, medium-high depth, great transitions, good carry, great drinkability.
Golden colour, medium head, sweet citrus sharp bitterness smell, dark hoppy almost stout like taste, cacao, with a firm bitter aftertaste
0.33l bottle. Hazy orange body, white head. Flowery, smoky, honeyish, bready aroma. Grassy hoppy taste with some honey. A nice one.

33cl. Bottle. 
Poors hazy yellow with white head. 
Aroma is malts, dreid fruit, sweet.
Taste is sweet, small bitter. 
Mouth-feel thin. 
Good beer.
Bottle pour. Hazy yellow with white head with good lacing. Bread, earth, lemon, straw, grass. Nice flowery hop finish. Real smooth drinking.

33ml flip top bottle. Opens with a nice popping sound. Pours a cloudy dark brownish amber with a small short lived beige head. Aroma is very malty, bready yeast with some light fruity notes. Taste of caramel malt, yeasty bready with some fruity notes and some light peppery hops bitterness. Palate is a smooth medium body with mild carbonation. Finishes with a nicely balanced combination of sweet caramel malt yeast, fruity notes with some light peppery hops bitterness ending is long and malty. Overall a good tasty and easy going brew.
A pretty nice beer. Somewhat sweet and some bitterness. Dark amber in color with a white head.

After the bitter, this one tasted better. more balanced. Quite good but their beers need some more kick. Strong malts though

Rather a keller than a pils. Hazy golden color with a persistent tall creamy head. Grassy aroma, malty notes. Maybe the alcohol notes are too invasive, and the hoppy counterpart is not my cup of tea. After all a good beer.

Little cloudy yellow to light beige head, very creamy off-white head, pretty stable and adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: grains, malts, a bit like it smells in a brewery, so Im going for wort, little herbal, but mainly the wort thing. MF: good carbon, medium to full body. Taste: grains, wort, little sweet touch, then bitter herbal hops, tobacco, pretty earthy. Aftertaste: grassy, hoppy bitterness, very bitter ending, not dry though. Not bad for a pilsener!
Fanatic beer with aroma and flavor in balance. Fruity and flowery notes. Good palate with bitterness.

Tap. Avenue pub. Pours a slightly hazy yellow gold body with a nice foamy white head that had nice retention. Unfiltered and beautiful looking. The nose is fresh grassy hops with just a little delicate bready maltiness below. The flavor is bright and wonderfully bitter, so much fresh hops in here, its nothing like what you typically get from a bottle. Soft bready maltiness underlies it all. Light bodied and refeshing with a bit of clinginess from the hops on the back end. Never tasted this beer so fresh. On tap is the only way to go with this.

March 20, 2012; 6.0% abv; 330mL Swingtop bottle, refrigerated at cellar temp., BBD: 04/12.  Bottle didnt pop. Sweet bready aroma with light caramel. Additionally fruitiness with a sort of light citrus burst from the hops.  Pours a very cloudy mulled apple cider colour. A thick white 1/2" head. Sediment in the bottle was pretty heavy. Guess this got a bit too cold at one point. . Tastes of bready malts with some light herbal bitterness from the hops. Bitterness becomes a little stronger as it warms - mostly herbal and earthy overtones. Beer is quite sweet -twizzler-ish. Medium to almost full-bodied. Nice light carbonation, suits the style well. Dry finish. Refreshing with good mouthfeel. A little too sweet for my liking. I dont know if this really counts as a pilsener...

Lovely beer, both visually and in taste. Nice luxurious foam with ample height. Nice golden tone which is slightly hazy because its a natural, not filtered quality beer. Multidimensional aroma which gives some lemon tones, bit of hoppines, etc. One of the best beers I have had. Beer brewn with love and care. This is how its supposed to be.
Beautiful hoppy smell that seeps through in the taste. I get mostly honey and hops. Almost like an English bitter. Slightly on the sweet side but a good beer. Bottle from Van Erp in Groningen.

33 cl bottle. Cloudy yellow colour. Big white head, stable. Strong hop Aromas. Taste is some Orange and sweet in the beginning evolving info a Strong bitter and dry hop finish. 
The bitterness is  overwhelming, lack of other Flavours

Wow! Jai vraiment apprécié cette bière mais quand jai vu quelle était classé PILSNER? 100 pour le style? Je suis un peu égaré avec ce classement mais pour ce qui est de la qualité, assez daccord. Corps soyeux qui glisse sur la langue, beaucoup dester avec une finale de houblon douce avec une amertume modéré. Peu spectaculaire mais vraiment intéressante dans la fabrication.

11.2 fl oz bottle. A very unique beer here in the lager style. To me, its really defined by its butterscotch cookie and grainy herbal bitter qualities. Pours with a frothy layer of soapy white head, decent retention, a semi-cloudy body, and golden orange in color. Cashews, butterscotch, fruity esters, brown sugars malts, and herbal funk make the aroma hard to gloss over. Really a one of a kind nose. The body is well carbonated, though creamy at the same time, like a lighter rootbeer float. Body is very malty upfront, becoming very bitter toward the end. I enjoyed this phase change quite a bit. Lots of bitter-sweet candy malts, butterscotch, honey, nuts, and mixed fruity esters in flavor. Grainy bitter leaf-herb and earth through the finish. Just a slight amount of off-bitter in there as well. Overall, this was definitely an intriguing beer, especially for the style. Pretty good stuff.
Orange and hazy. Aroma of flowers and citrus. Taste of eucalyptus and fruits. Tastes like basement. Good stuff.

Az illata kellemes visszafogott, enyhe mézes-virágos, háttérben citrusokat is ki lehet venni. Szép fehér habja van, amely egészen hosszan kitart. A színe igazán szemrevaló látvány, nagyon jól mutat ez a halvány narancssárgás szín, és én valahogy én erről is a mézre asszociálok. Akárcsak az illata, az íze is visszafogott. Enyhén édeskés, de a komlóval jól kiegészülve nem megy el túlzottan ebbe az irányba. Nem az én világom, de egy nagyon jó kis sör, kevésbé édes süteményekkel meglepően jól harmonizál (én pl. gyümölcskenyér mellé próbáltam).
(bottle) cloudy pale gold with medium white head; wonderful aroma of honey, citrus, spruce; dry balanced flavour with long medium bitter finish, excellent

A nyitott üvegből bizonytalan, mély komlóaroma árad, nem az IPA féle vihar, hanem valami mély mordulás. Kitöltve meglepően szőke a sör, színe a vékonyra csiszolt aranylemezé. Szép, fehér, közepesen tartós és kövér, csipkés habja van. Még bele sem ittam, de a komlóillat fokozatosan erősödik. Aztán a számhoz emeltem, és már majdnem beleittam, amikor a pohár öblében olyan sűrűre koncentrálódott a komlószag, hogy egy pillanatra egy teljesen összehúgyozott férfivécé szúrós bűze döfött az orromba, erre hamar elkaptam a számtól a poharat. Nyilvánvaló, hogy a komló a fő attrakció. Ez kicsit szomorkás ízű európai komló, fáradt és dekadens, de nagyon művelt, nagyon finom. Ez párosul némi lágeres édességgel és könnyed, pezsgőszerű, aranyszín testtel. Egyszerre laktató és üdítő, elegáns kompozíció. 
Hónapokkal később második kóstolás teljesen más:
Gyümölcsös, élesztős illat
Homályos sápadt sárga szín
Kellemes keserű, kiegyensúlyozott maláta
Lassan és elegánsan fordul rá a jól felismerhető saaz-komlóra
Karakteresen keserű, de nem száraz, nem durva utóíz, érett , férfias, kellemes, elegáns és sima
Nice pilsner, smooth taste with a nice bitter finish. I would try this beer again by choice

Hazy gold with a puffy white head. Aroma of lemon zest, melons, herbs. Lightish texture for a 6% lager is slightly creamy. Taste has mellow stone fruits and pronounced but gentle bitterness. Finish is very nice - not sharply bitter and not quite dry but with lingering herbs and earth. Good balanced beer that leaves you with a mouthful of classy hops. 330 mL bottle from the LCBO, served in a pilsener glass. Pours slightly hazy straw-golden with a small white head. The head soon fades but leaves a good amount of fine lace before it does. Overall, an excellent pilsener. It has a beautiful pine-spice quality from the Saaz hops. I would have liked a bit more carbonation and better head retention, but it was very tasty and definitely worth another try. 2010-09-26

Bottle at home. Pours a hazy coppery golden color with a thin white head that quickly dissipates. Aroma is leathery hoppy and grassy and a bit cheesy. Complex taste with hops, some spicy bitterness, grass and oranges. Very nice.

Bottle. Hazy orange pour with a short white head that doesnt last long. Aroma is sweet and fruity with notes of honey, caramel and citrus. Flavour is pretty much the same but less sweet. Quite dry on the palate with a lengthy bitter finish. Slightly unusual but very nice pilsener nonetheless.

0.33 l flip-top.
Hazy golden colour, medium fine pored head, average/lively carbonation.
It has a pleasant hoppy (with some yeast in the back) nose, the start is sweet and sharp.
The tastes sweet and honey-liked, aromas of floral hops. The finish is bitter, dry and remains long. Bodys medium, textures light sticky and slick. NIce pilsner styled brew.

Grassy and floral hop aroma, almost sourdough bready note. Aggressive bitterness, yet still "soft". Quenching and comforting at once. A lovely hoppy beer with a spicy yeast note running through it and tying it all together.

Pours a beautiful thick amber, almost honey colour. Thin white head. Beautiful fruity aroma, hints of caramel. Fantastic, almost creamy feel when tasting. Smooth and slightly bitter taste with touches of caramel. Absolutely cracking beer, highly recommended.
Beautiful cloudy dirty yellow colour.  Aroma is hop, caramel and hop.  Taste is yeast, caramel, sweet hop with a little bit of bitterness.  Very enjoyable dubbel.
bottle, by trade with beachbum25, golden color with white thick foam, nice structure and good malty belgian aroma, flavors of wheaty, hops with more belgian fruit flavors

Slightly hazy, deep golden color with mostly diminishing, airy head. Aroma of earty yeast, honeyish malts, resinous, pine-like hops and
just a slight grassiness. Amazing flavor of honey, sweet bready malts contesting with resinous, oily hops. Medium to full bodied with oily texture and
soft carbonation. If i wouldnt know about its origin id think that this ones brewed in a small czech or german microbrewery. Wonderfully complex pilsner.

Kissé ködös,aranysárga színe és szép fehér kemény habja van.Illata komlós és malátás is egyben.Íze fűszeres,kellemesen váltja a maláta édességét a komló gyümölcsös keserűje.Utóíze száraz,kívánja a következőt.Remek társasági ital.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2009 Strange. Unfiltered pilsnerer. It has a fruity(orange) and intensive  aroma like a belgian ale. without head and lacing. The flavour was a bit strange for me, because i missed the hoppiness, what a pilsners main characteristic. Alcohol is well-hidden. Sweet aftertaste.
Bottle. Very sweet caramel, toffey aromas some chocolate. Taste is very much the same some hops but rather faint behind all the malty flavors. Full body for this style. Quite enjoyable.

Poured into a footed pilsner with aromas of malts and honey. There was no head at all, which surprised me. The aromas was sweet and so was the initial taste. The end was bittersweet with a hint of citrus lurking at the back of my palate. Not a bad beer.
Bottle, 33cl. Pours a pale golden beer with a firm head. The aroma is hops and flowers. The flavor is hops, citrus, elderflowers and honey. The palate is bitter and dry. Overall a good beer.

There are some really good flavours here, both hoppy and a yeasty fruity flavours. But somehow the balance is all off and it just doesnt have that much going for it. I think that the flavour needs to be more focused with under/overtones, this is alright but just doesnt work that well.

tasted a 33 ml bottle. On poaring a nice head that remains stable for some time. The apperance is blond to copper. The aroma is spicy, hoppy with a caramel nose. The taste is sweet, malty and spicy but not that hoppy / bitter as the label suggests. The aftertaste however is bitter. The palate is a litlte rough, puckering.
Overall a good beer that could be a little dryer.
UPDATED: DEC 7, 2010 On bottle and on tap. Lovely pilsener beer with fine hoppy taste. A full coloured and full tasting beer.

Very hazy orange-brown pour.  Dark tint with a thin white head.  Grainy malt arom with some tart spice.  Bitter grain flavor with almost a rye-like twang to it.  Slightly spicy with some tartness.  Honey and molasses notes.
On tap at In de Wildeman. Cloudy golden with a lacing, offwhite head. Fruity and bready aroma. Bready and spicy flavours as well as some grassiness. Good carbonation. A quite complex blond.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich malt, fruits, flowers and hops. Some notes of caramel as well.

opaque golden orange, quickly disapating head. nose; very nice, citrus, floral, apricots, sweet candy, dried wood, dried plums + nutmeg. 
Taste; very bitter the whole route down, strongly vegetal, herbal, sweet spices. good.

11.2 oz swingtop bottle-cloudy golden color w/a moderate white head & good lacing. Aroma of floral hops. Has a nice little floral hop bite to it, some pine, pineapple, green apple, a little orange peel, & grapefruit as well. Solid, easy drinking brew, long dry finish.
Bottle. Pours hazy amber colour with nice thick white head. Fruity nose. Body is thick and creamy, a bit sour and good hoppy finish. Overall a nice brew.

330 mL flip-top Bottle. This one poured a murky deep gold body due to sediment in the bottle. Thin but nice creamy-bubbly head leaving ample lace on the sides. Intense and inviting aroma of malt, hops, wildflowers and a note of pineapple with a sweet syrupy tang to it. Rich malt-caramel flavor with an innuendo of orange peel with a clean hoppy-fruity aftertaste and a butterscotch-nutty-fruity finish. Nice smooth carbonation. This is one for Pay Day.

Bottle served in a footed pilsner. Hazey yellow-orange color. Large fluffy head with substantial lacing. Almost looks like a hefe. Nice. Some fruit (oranges) and light hops on the nose. Light-medium body. Soft carbonation and a classic dry pilsener finish. Top notch pils.

Flaske: Orange uklar øl med et fint skumhoved. Lække crisp humle duft. Dejlig frisk i smagen og glider utrolig let ned. Det eneste minus er de farlige 6 % man absolut ikke lægger mærke til i denne lækre tørstslukker.

This came in a swingtop bottle, and poured with a tremdendously large, foamy white head and a hazy gold colour.  The head fell away to leave some very nice lacing, and the aroma was somewhat subdued, featuring some slight hopping and perhaps also a bit florid.  Taste waa slightly bitter (not sour) and refreshing.

330ml bottle (Cracked Kettle, Amsterdam)
Lovely fruity hoppy aroma as it purs clear, with a bit of yeast added, the aromas breadier, and the fruit becomes less fleshy, more citrussy. Hazy orange, tiny head. Pleasant carbonation, pleasant tingle from that and hops. Touch of soap from the hops, perfumey too. Lovely light grain body. Lovely balance. This is like a belgian ale with dutch hopping. Yes, I said ale - this is an ale brewed with lager yeast, and is certainly no pilsener. Finish is a great fruity and grainy mix, ends on a rich barky bitterness. Wow - I like "pilsener"

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2010 330ml bottle. Pours hazy yelllow with a medium white fluffy head. Head retention is short. Great lacing. Nose is hops spices and malt. Taste is quite bitter. Quite malty. Quite refreshing and fresh. Some sweetness in the taste. Finish is long and hoppy. Carbonation is average. Bottle is absolutely gorgeous ! Very nice beer. Good pilsner fix 

Re-rate 100602. Aroma 7 to 8. Over 15 to 16. Total score 3.6 to 3.8

Quite bitter, however, the aroma will disclose none of that and despite the evident hop bitterness, aromatic hops are not present in this beer. This was sort of an interesting experience in a way, being extremely dry without having a significant aromatic hop presence, but certainly a nice beer. Excellent excellent excellent for a pilsner.

Ive had this before and remembering liking more... 
Poured out a yellowish brew with light orange hues, very large light tan head with tons of lacing and a good amount of suspended sediment. The aroma was a bit skunky which I dont remember from before, orange, lemon, wheat. The taste was off with it being on the sour side, light yeast and came across mostly as a watery bitter mix. Mouth feel was smooth with ample carbonation, solid bitterness and a long, bitter finish. Ive had better bottles of this so Ill give it the benefit of the doubt and consider a re-review. The last note on my original review says in large letters "THIS SUCKS"...
Bottle at Toscano in Bangalore.  One of the best lagers that I have drunk.  Nice head, lacing - the hops are prominent and a clean aftertaste.

Tap and bottle. The tap and bottle versions are almost different beers! 
Both are gold-yellow and slightly cloudy. But, from the tap the hops aroma and flavours are so much more discrete-really jump up from the glass and hit you from half a metre away. Compared to this the bottled version is far more subdued. Next time Im in Roermond Ill another a few more from the tap!
Pours out orange-coloured, foamy head. Hazy. Aromas of citron, orange, honey. Doesnt drink easily: bitter, but fresh. Finish is dry, a bit too dry.

Once again the only description of this beer can be Metamucil, I have so many beers that look like this, but this glass of Metamucil comes with a thick soft creamy cap with great retention and lots of micro floaters. Aroma is highly unappealing mild skunk, lemon but only at the start, some darker stinky malts, and a touch of urinal to finish it off. Taste is equally unappealing as the aroma, dark sour malts, a wet barn, and some out of place vanilla. Flavor is mild but unpleasant Im highly disappointed in this beer I must of picked an old bottle that was stored in the sun on top of heater. And why is this located under the pilsner category it has nothing in common with any pilsner Ive ever come across. found out after was a very old bottle

This is still my reference if I drink a pilsner. 
The beer is unfiltered, amber colour, bit hazy. You smell the richness of the hops. The taste is sweet yet bitter of the hops.

330ml Bottle:  Aroma of noble hops, slight spice, hay, slight herbs, Saaz hops, and a hint of yeast.  Pours orange/amber/flaxen in color with a large, dense, fluffy, off-white head that lasted throughout.  Cloudy.  Sparkling.  Full of tiny particles throughout.  Very good lacing.  Flavor is lightly sweet and light to medium bitter.  Tastes of noble hops, Saaz, herbs, slight grains, and some Pils malts.  Medium body.  Smooth, creamy texture.  Soft to average carbonation.  Lightly bitter, hoppy, herbal finish.

Quite a distinguished Pilsener, with its best feature being its flavor, which has a pronounced taste of noble hops, as announced in the label. The bitterness is much more delicate - different - from commercial regular Pilseners. The appearance is pretty much the same, yellow body, good head formation and lacing. Metallic finish, lively carbonation and a light body, with watery texture.
bottle - hazy orange beer with a white head. Fruity aroma. Flavour has nice hops notes and some fruty notes.

330ml flip-top bottle poured into a Trappist glass.  CB/B is an unfiltered beer and shows in the murky pour.  It is grapefruit juice yellow, resembling an unfiltered wit.  The head is medium-sized with clumpy pockets of bubbles.  The aroma is both sweet, like overripe fruit and tart with acids.  It has a Belgian smell that also reminds me of high alcohol barley wines.  Wow!  What a surprise.  This beer is as dry as it gets.  It rolls off of your tongue and down your throat like water on concrete mix.  Its hard to pinpoint the various tastes but lemon, pepper and hops shine through.  This beer is quite light considering the 6% ABV.  Im not happy with the Pilsener classification it carries though.  It strikes me more like a generic Belgian ale.  It think this beer would go well with Chinese chicken dishes like sweet & sour chicken or lemon chicken.
A spectacular saaz bomb and one of the most unique beers I have tasted. Very aromatic and dry and the aftertaste goes on quite a bit. Very tasty.
One of better pilsner/lagers Ive had.  Tried from cool 11.2oz flip top bottle.  Nice and fresh and hoppy.  Very east to drink.  Unfiltered cloudy orange color.  A bit of lemon tartness,

Thanks to Glouglouburp for the bottle! Beautiful looking beer, hazy golden/amber with a fluffy white head long lasting and clumpy all over the glass. Lots of pale malt, grass, grain, and bitter hop in the aroma, citrus the strongest element. The flavor is similar, like eating a field: sweet, grainy malt notes with a little sugar, all coupled to hop bitterness and citrus. Not overly carbonated but definitely dry, long finish. Great stuff here: really rustic and really delicious, totally aggressive and flavorful, and yet never one-sided. Gone in about five minutes.
Straw color with white head.  Spices and herbs.  Hoppy aftertaste with a touch of fruit.

Dark yellow colored with hazy appearance. Little yellow head. Strongly flowery-hopped saaz aroma with rich fruits, grains, some appricot, yeast, fine aroma indeed. Medium bodied. Flavor is similar with dominating hops and fruits, appricot and raisins also here. Aftertaste lasts with hops. Excellent beer, still this is weird that I had to come to India to try this...

Bottle. Pours a hazy straw amber body with a two finger white head.  Lots of spices in the nose, pepper and lots of fruit.  coriander apple skins and some moth.  Honey and a light bitterness to finish.  Pretty good.

Bouteille de 330 ml, avec bouchon de céréamique, obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie. Arôme: Odeur dhoublons et de céréales. Apparence: La couleur est blonde orangée voilée. Présence dun large col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de céréales et dhoublons avec une pointe fruitée. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est plein avec une texture huileuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Présence de céréales en arrière goût. (Rating #2163)

Orange gold body.  Large, frothy white cream.  Immense nose hints of spicy fresh hops and bright fruit.  Hop flavor is mind-blowingly intricate.  Peppery, spicy, super fruity, herbal, fresh.  Very noble-like, but great utilization.  Brilliant lager!

hazy yellow beer with a white head
smells hoppy malty and bittersweet with some fruit and some honey
tasts hoppy, bittersweet and of both herbs and fruits plus an interesting honey-like floral taste
aftertaste is hops, fruits, good bitterness and a sweet hint
Maybe I should have this beer in Denmark.  It was so oxidized, the taste was extremely compromised.

Straw colour with good carbonation and large frothy white head and aroma hoppy malt bread wheat note grassy floral note.Flavour nice bitter fruit taste followed by a maltiness nut taste yeast hop flavour good fruity floral decent bitter.Finish bitter dry.

overflows when i open the bottle.  after a resonable wait, it pours hazy amber, big rocky head, decent lacing.  aroma of malt with a bit of mustiness.  flavor seems floral and mild vegetable.  medium bodied, dry finish.  i do not get a lot of hops in this one.  not very exciting.  single bottle from binnys beverage depot in orland park.

(Bottle).  Semi-sweet aroma, very piney with some spicey fruitiness.  Cloudy yellow-orange body, huge creamy white head.  Flavor begins slightly sweet, with tart fruit, then transitions into delicious hoppy bitterness which persists throughout a lingering finish.  A super lager.

In short: A fantastic pilsner with all the characteristics of a fresh draught bohemian pilsner.
How: Bottle 330ml flip-top.  Consumed fresh as soon as I received through private importation
The look: Cloudy dark blonde body topped by a large white head with good retention
In long: Nose is noble grassy hops and meringue.  Tasty cereals, light honeyed sweetness quickly taken over by the dry and slightly spicy grassy hops.  Dry wood notes.  Bready yeast or bready malts, I dont know but bready something. Body is smooth and chewy and the carbonation is very lively.  Ive pub-crawled in Czech Republic and I find the Christoffel to be the most authentic Czech draft Bohemian Pilenser that Ive had in the comfort of my home.  And the beer is not from Czech Republic, its not draft and its officially not even a Bohemian Pilsner.  WTF?  Ok, maybe I also find Taco Bells to be the most authentic typical Mexican homemade food.
Shared this one w/ SkyCop32.  Picked up at Maruhn Getränke in Darmstadt.  Pours a golden yellow with a white head.  Aromas of bread/malts/hops.  Crisp hop flavor with hints of fruit/malt.

Bottle. Moderate hoppy, light citrus, very spicy. A very large white creamy head, very long lasting. The body is yellow. A very hoppy taste with a very bitter finish. The duration is long. Very dry texture, light creamy, lively carbonation, medium body. A good beer.

Poured cloudy straw coloured with frothy head which quickly disappears. Aroma was sweet and yeasty. First impression is sweet and mellow with little bitterness but finishes herbally with increasing bitter aftertaste. Very unusual beer.
Hazy gold pour. fluffy white head. Tropical fruit aroma with notable hints of grains. Yeasty flavors with a grassy finish
Cloudy golden with tiny white head. Sweet aroma with malty and cardboardish notes. Flavour likewise with a sweet finish.
33 cL bottle. Pours clear and golden orange with a creamy white head. Slight spiced mild cornish aroma. Light cornish and bitter flavour. Lingering dry and bitter finish with a light spice accent.

Bottle.  Brandon recommended this one to me, so I bought it.  Pours out a nice blond / yellowish color.  Cloudy, not like typical pils that I see here.  Smell is fruity, yeasty, and sweet with some grass flavors and a tiny bit of hops.  Taste is lively in carbonation, sweet, easy to drink with a nice dry finish.  This beer was really good and a nice surprise that I wasnt expecting.  Thanks for the recommendation.
330ml bottle. hazy ornage colour. medium white , fading head. yeast and hop in taste.

Poured a hazy golden color.  Aroma was fairly faint.  A little hops, a little biscuit.  Fairly thin.

Flavor was more of the same.  Very mellow beer to the point of being almost. . . shy.  There were some good qualities here, but they were in hiding.

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2010 Draught at Arendsnest. Most appealing looking beer I can remember. Lovely golden. Amaxing hops from nose through flavor to finish. A absolute showcase for fresh noble hops. Great. Bottle, in Toronto 8/4/8/4/16. Light to medium amber, very cloudy, tall white head, frothy. Aroma of honey, malt, some hops, cereals, sweet lemon. Strong flavor, rich malt, slightly sweet, but with a hop bite. Honey, grains, alcohol. Very hoppy, bitter finish, dry and long-lasting. Very interesting. An amber lager with a Belgian-like yeast character. Nice stuff.

swing-top bottle (330ml). -Cloudy golden coloured, medium sized white head, barnyard nose. Malty, light hoppy and flowery taste with yeasty and metallic notes. Touch of lemony spiceness in the strong bitter finish.
clear gold blond coloured body with a white head a yeasty malty aroma a yeasty malty fruity taste with a sweet bitter finish
Blondgold coloured beer with small wite head. Sweet fruity aroma. Full palat. Finish is herby.

Light amber coloured beer with some very light carbonation and a medium white head. Sweet fruity malty and yeasty aroma. Medium to full palate. FInish is yeasty, alcoholic and sweeter vanilla touched. Stronger light bitter sweeter ending. Not bad.

Bottle. Hazy yellow, nice lasting white head. Fruity, hoppy aroma, some grapefruit, citrus and grass. Hoppy citrus flavor, some pine apple, some grass, netallic notes. Dry hoppy finish with grapefruit and apricot notes.

Bottled.Cloudy yellow/orange color, nice fluffy white head with a dense lace. Hops aroma with notes of roasted sugar and citrus. Flavor has a spicy hop notes, some sweetness. Finish is hopy, good one!

330 ml swing top bottle from Beers of Europe. Good flavour - good dose of hops. A hearty and very drinkable strong lager with a lovely lingering hop bitterness. Good fruit, good carbonation. All lagers should be like this. Excellent.

04-Feb-08 (330-ml swing-top bottle: Purchased 18-Nov-07 for $3.79 at Holiday Wine Cellar in Escondido, CA)  The beer pours golden-amber in color and very cloudy from visible chunks of suspended particles.  Not what I would expect from a "blond" lager.  The off-white head, however, is tall and creamy, very gradually settling to a thin layer and wide ring with large patches of dense lace left on the glass.  Smelling the beer, the hops aroma dominates and is redolent of dry hay and musty magazines stored up in the attic, but the nose also offers a bit of sweet honey-like maltiness in the background.  The flavor is more traditional lager: clean, grainy malts with minimal sweetness, but this is balanced wonderfully by bright, grassy, moderately bitter hops.  A slight toastiness emerges in the finish as the beer warms a bit.  Dry, dusty and slightly chalky mouthfeel, clean bitterness and moderate carbonation complement the medium body of the malty base for a beer that is refreshing, easy and fun to drink.

Bottle, from BSF at the GBBF. Pale honey pour with a lot of clean white ultra-fine head. Herb garden on a cold dewy morning, tangerine, a little bile note. Ultra-soft grainy malt sweetness blended seemlessly with minty herbal hops. Hopping is brisk, but the balance still leans slightly toward malt. Lingering husk and mint. Well-crafted and interesting.

Brown bottle, 33 cl, best before 04 2009, purchased at the la LCBO, savoured on August 7 2008; eye: golden with a orange hue, hazy, light effervescence, voluminous white head that falls and turns into a blanket to protect the beer, a bit of lacing; nose: refreshing hops, grapefruit, resinous hops, light grainy malt, pine; mouth: assaulting, resinous hops, pine, grainy malt, lots of carbonation, yeast, fizzy, clove, banana, dry hops, alcohol, finale in hops with a lightly sweet malt and a bit of clove and banana, rather bitter, quite carbonated, medium-full body, slightly grainy texture; overall: quite likable

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 33 cl, meilleure avant 04 2009, achetée à la LCBO, savourée le 7 août 2008; il : dorée avec une teinte orangée, voilée, légère effervescence, mousse blanche abondante qui tombe et devient une petite couverture pour protéger la bière, un peu de dentelle; nez : houblon rafraîchissant, pamplemousse, houblon résineux, léger malt granuleux, pin; bouche : agressante, houblon résineux, pin, malt granuleux, beaucoup de carbonatation, levure, pétillante, clou de girofle, léger banane, houblon sec, alcool, finale en houblon avec malt légèrement sucrée et une touche de clou de girofle et de banane, plutôt amère, pas mal carbonatée, corps moyen-corsé, texture légèrement granuleuse; en résumé : bien aimé

Bottled -> Poured a light brown colour with a bit of visible sediment. Had a very strong off white head for a good minute, but eventually settled. Had a nice smooth mouthfeel, and a nice hoppy taste, the only downfall was that I could really taste the alcohol in this one.. Still good though..

On tap @ Café Gollem. Hazy golden appearance, white head. Nose of malts, citrus and hops, flowery. Taste is soft, malty, and a good deal of bitterness. Really smooth and quaffable, excellent beer to start off the evening.

33cl swingtop bottle. pours hazy golden with white head. the aroma starts off rather sweet, honey, with some nice noble hops that are floral, rather green and sometimes minty. the flavors are also sweet of honey, clove, with flroal and spicy hop notes. mild bitterness is pleasing to the palate. full mouth feel and smooth carbonation. this is really great pils reminding me of the great belgian-style pilsners and i bet it even better on tap.

Bottle. Pours a hazy blond with a fluffy white head. Nose of sweet fruits, alcohol, yeast, slight astrigent. Taste is sweet, quickly going extremely bitter with a a fast earthy dry hop finish. Light body, maybe a bit too light for me.

Pours a rich hazy golden color with few bubbles and a large rocky tan head... looks like someone put a scoop of ice-cream in my beer.  Floral spicy hop aroma with some rich toasty malts backing it up.  Very bready first taste, butterscotch, and bitter earthy hops.  Rich finish.  Velvety medium/full body.   A good beer and an interesting pilsner, malty.

0.33L bottle, courtesy of Ryan.  Thanks!  Pours a slightly hazy, golden-orange color; textured off-white head with great retention and tight, fine-bubbled lacing that coats the glass; great pour.  Very nice, crisp aroma: candied fruits, lime-infused bitterness, minerals, crackers; far more complexity than one would expect from something so crisp and dry; excellent.  Medium mouthfeel: mouthwatering acidity and citrus and mineral bitterness upfront; the lime note follows from the nose, along with dry crackers, zesty hops, and excellent drinkability; lively levels of carbonation keep it alive in the mouth; dry, crisp, generously hopped pilsener, with the added bonus of a very solid candied fruit / authentic candy sugar character that doesnt come off sticky or distracting.  Excellent stuff.  Thanks to Ryan for bringing back a fresh bottle of this from Michigan.  Lengthy finish: dry breadiness and crackers, toasted malts, and lasting zesty minerals and lime.

Via trade with matt7215. Thanks! This is a very good pilsener Aroma was a bit fruity with a lemon tang. Pour was a cloudy gold/near orange with a nice 2 finger white head. Taste was a little sweeter than I was expecting, but very crisp and refreshing. Bread and yeast in the front with a mouth drying hoppy bitterness in the aftertaste. Nice prickly carbonation.

Tasted at SDCF.  Hazy golden with a foamy white head.  Fruity sweet aroma and taste with a bready, belgian yeast, and a crisp semi-dry finish.
0.33l bottle. Pours a hazy golden orange with a smallish head. Strong hoppy aroma. Taste is very bitter amd very strong, but also complex. Notes of citrus, yeast and malt. Not bad.

Finally found a fresh bottle of this to rate. Hazy golden body with medium sized, frothy white head. The nose is well balanced blend of doughy, honey malt and earthy, herbal hops. The taste is just about perfect. Just a touch of sweetness, lots of bitterness, very hop forward with a nice taste of spicy herbs. Malts are doughy with a touch of cotton candy and honey. Finishes with clean yeast and solid, lasting bitterness. Medium body is round and smooth with moderate, tight carbonation. Brilliant. An absolute classic.
Unclear yellow-orange colour, medium white head. Aroma is hoppy and fruity.  Very much carbonated.  Taste is malty with some dry, grassy hops.
Pours a hazy orange with a rich white head.    Fruity aroma.  Strong, dry hoppy taste.  Light carbonation.  Bitter finish.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2009 my original impression of this beer was that it was not all that.  I have since tried it again and it has come up a few notches for sure.  Has a light fruitiness on the nose and has a a sweet fruitiness in its taste also.  It is a nice easy drinking and refreshing brew.  Not anything over the top and, if my memory serves me, is a little overpriced.  All in all a decent brew and considering the style has a little more to it than your prototypical pilsener

Pours a hazy somewhere between yellow and orange, with a mammath head that needed sometime to subside before I could get at her. Taste is quite sharp, dry hoppy goodness...so refreshing, nice bitter finish. A great summertime brew, I dont expect to find a better pilsener than this.

330mL bottle from the LCBO.  Pours very foamy, murky orange with a huge head.  Nose is pretty much standard floral hops, but taste is delicious, most floral pilsner Ive ever had, even notes of lavender.  Smooth, lightly carbonated mouthfeel.  Excellent.
Bottle. Hazy orange with a nice white head. Very hoppy, with lightl malt and fruit. Nicely bitter and well carbonated. Refreshing, would drink again.
Very nice. Slight hoppy taste.Bubbly texture and big head. Goes down smooth and has a slight oine taste.

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2009 Nice pilsner(?) beer! Nice appearance with an amber body and a foamy white-buttery head. Fruity, floral hoppy and malt nose, Rich body and texture with taste of hop, some pale malt and yeast. Fine aftertaste.

Beer pours...um, like dark orange(?).  The darkest pilsner Ive ever had, for sure!  The aroma is sweet malt and maybe even some fruitiness.  The flavor is sweet floral notes and fruity malt that was really sweet with maybe even a touch of sour, caramel malt and a nice rounding out bitterness.  This beer is very atypical for style.  I enjoyed it...and would have given it hugely high ratings if it only had more funky grassy type hops in there so typical for the style.
creative for a pills, a bit darker and with less clarity than the others.  floral and green in aroma but not lacking the nice bitter hop finish.  almost alpine in some ways.

hazier and darker than a traditional pilsener with huge white head.  flavor is of munich malt, more pronounced than the traditional pilsner malt component and finishes with a prominent hop bitterness before a dry ending.  very nice version
Pours a hazy golden beer with a dense head. Aroma of flowers, straw, grass and fruits. The flavours are bitter, pine-like on a caramel-base.

(3/13/08) Bottle at Gollem in Amsterdam. Hazy golden with a medium white head. Floral aroma of hops. Great flavor which starts malty sweet and continues with bitter fresh hops flavor and some fruits. Medium-bodied.  Good stuff.

Bottle. Interestingly enough, when I popped the swing top on this the rubber gasket stayed near glued to the bottle and only the plastic came up. The pressure inside the bottle and the now very small opened created about a 1" fountain of foam that sprayed everywhere. Good times.

Barring that, there was surprisingly little head on this. Flavor is ultra-biscuity and great czech hops, with a unique nutmeg  and cinnamon-raisin bread aroma that is very pleasant. Goes down real easy. This stuff is great.

Bottle, 33 cl. (bought @ Hopduvel)
Aroma, little spicy, hops, malts.
Medium body.
Taste sweet, malts, well balanced, good  hoppy beer, long bitterness.
Nice one from Holland.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2010 A dark blond beer. Its not hell at all. It has a rocky large white head. The aroma of hop is all around, also some fruits, like grapefruit. The taste has a nice bitterness. In the background some sweet, not to much. A very good beer for a warm summerday. I thought that the beer, in the past has more bitterness.
Pale amber color with a rich creamy head. Has a musty cellar, hoppy spice smell. Medium bodied and smooth. Has a grassy, skunky taste which is spot on Heineken. Finishes crisp and bitter. 2137
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Cloudy golden with a huge pillowy white head displaying excellent retention. Massive aromas of sourdough and spices. Doughy malts, herbal spicey funky hppiness and a lip-smacking bitterness. Amazing!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
UPDATED: OCT 1, 2008 Huge white head, little hazy golden colour. Flowery, herbal and a weak grainy aroma. Not that clean, in nose as in mouth. 

********RE-Rate**********
Nice honey malt aroma mingling with a assertive Saaz hoppiness. Starts a bit grainy but still sweet towards a dry hoppy bitter end. Nice one.

Bottled. Thx Gustaf.
Hazy golden with a small, white head.
Slightly sourish with fresh hops and berries.
Really dry and bitter finish with some butterscotch.

Cant believe I hadnt rated this before! Cloudy pale yellow with a big, firm and lasting white head. Spicy noble hops, a hint of citrus and a good dose of pilsner malt in the nose. Very bitter with a nice hop flavour. Refreshing, has a good body, and a lasting pine-hoppy aftertaste.

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2012 Pours a cloudy yellow colour with tight head. Aroma is a little musty with some lighter sweeter notes to be found too. Flavour has some floral hop. Its a little sharp and zesty to begin with before strong hop bitterness dominates. This is a great thirst quencher.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2009 Bottled 33cl. It pours a hazy, light orange beer with a rocky, rich whitish head. The nose of pine needles, grapefruit, elderflower, oranges and peaches. Wonderfully hoppy, grassy, sappy with a transcendent delicate floral touch. Some lemon and yeast in the aroma too. The taste is extremely bitter with pine needles and grapefruit accompanied by oranges, lemon and elderflowers. Sappy, floral and wonderfully hoppy. Some marmelade combines with a crisp toastiness. Honey sneaking in after a few sips. This beer a perfect, beautiful lacing. A beer with a remarkable appearance. I m clearly giving 5 points here. The finish is very powerful,  dry and bitter with hints of grapefruit, heather and lemon showing up. I wonder how high the IBU of this beer is.... Anyway, a great brew. After several samplings: Definately a great beer. Wonderfully bready with a sublime hop profile. Excellent. A lot of hemp and lemongrass showing up in both aroma and taste.
Hmmmm, bottle - grassy, grassy nose, like drinking a glass of mown grass mixed with miller. Cant see why it is worth CAD$9

Bottle bought at the L.C.B.O. in Ottawa. The color is hazy honey with a thick white head. The taste is of hops and some citrus fruits. It is good as a pilsner wich is not my favorite kind but still good.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a slightly cloudy yellow with a small white head and a smell of grains and citrus. The taste Is really hoppy with hints of cinnamon and citrus. A nice hoppy finish , a great pilsener!

On draft at Arendsnest, Amsterdam.  Im not normally a huge pilsner fan, but there was something fresh and delicious about that ale that made me happy I was drinking it.  Id go back to it for a light night out if I had normal access to it.  Tasty, fresh and hoppier than the average pilsner.

33cl bottle at Gollem, Amsterdam, 12-2-07.   slightly hazy gold with a nice white head.   Aroma is very hop dominated - floral and herbal.   Very fresh.    The flavor is dominated by the hops, and I love it.   Medium body.   Simply the best pilsener that Ive had.
Pours cloudy deep gold with a good sized off white head.  Suprisingly sweet aroma, bread, dank hops.  Taste is biscuty with a bit of spice, grass and must.  Very interesting.

Have had thisone for beer-speeches some times and the crowd are always surprised. As mentioned, its a hopheads delight. Bitter as XX-bitter and hommelbier with notes of straw, good metal, perfume, bread, lots of ingredients and more, more, more. Great beer!

From a 330mL Bottle.  Purchased at Holiday Wine Cellar 11/10/07.  The date on the bottle is unclear, but this is definitely fresh.  Pours a somewhat hazy, graham cracker hued gold with a thick layer of rocky ivory head.  Baked french bread crusts and gentle euro hops mix together, creating an herbal biscuit image.  Pleasant hop perfume, along with some doughy characters.  Medium light bodied, softly carbonated mouthfeel with a plush palate.  Starts out with firm, baked bread pilsner malt flavor before transitioning gently into a mildly spicy hop finish.  This is a longing desire to bake fresh bread in a brick oven on a warm breezy summer afternoon while enjoying the scents of summer float by on a gentle breeze.  Lots of hop flavor without much bitterness.  Finishes moderately dry, but clean.  Simple, elegant flavors.

This was one of the bigger disappointments Ive had recently.  It tasted old even though I was assured by the beer shop it had just arrived.  Pours golden blond with a sudsy white head.  The aroma has pils malt, creaminess and light butter.  Medium / light body with semi-sharp carbonation.  The flavor begins with a bit of cream, sharp citrus / lemon and light woodiness.  The finish had some spice and mustiness.  I was hoping for a crisp, grassy, hoppy pils and this didnt fit the bill.  If I can get a guaranteed fresh bottle Ill gladly rerate.
Interesting beer. Grassy for sure but not anything I would call offensive in this impressive pilsner. Finely hopped and crisply dry.

golden withhuge white head, never fades, great lacing. Big floral/grass/hay aroma. Pils malt sweetness in the background. Flavor exactly as advertisedd. Some fruity esters to start, followed by a huge grassiness through the middle, floral kicks in again near the finish. Not as clean as I expected. Tad too much grass for my liking, otherwise decent.

De mémoire - Bière bien faite, meilleure très froide. Son amertume est un peu trop présente à mon goût. 
À consommer pour contrebalancer un repas aux parfums persistants.
Bottel.33cl. Rocking head but hazy fluide, never the less, fine looking beer, good hop aroma and bitterness, a fine beer.
Bottle @ Gollem, Amsterdam. Pale to medium blonde yellow color. Medium carbonation. Floral, slighly fruity. Dry pilsner finish. Nice beer

Bottle, bought @ LIVA, Kolding (Domhusgade). A light hazy pale yellow with a medium bubbly yellowish head. Aroma is citric with pineapple and a floral hoppy edge to it. Mouthfeel is very round. Flavour is a complex mixture of citric bitterness, malty caramel and sweetness as well as tones of honey, pine, oranges and spices. Very nice pilsner.

Bottle:  The aroma is moderate citrus and lemon with with equal parts floral and piney hops and light yeastiness.  Pours a hazy orange with a moderate white head that lasts a minute or so and leaves behind great lacing.  The flavor starts with a light fruitiness with hints of lemon, sweet orange, and faint yeast.  The finish is lightly floral with a hint of piney hops.  Light, bordering on medium, bodied with soft carbonation.  Certainly more than Ive come to expect from a pilsner.

11.2 fl oz from west lakeview liqours in Chicago.  Very hazy orange-yellow appearance with small off-white head.  Aroma is very sweet light fruit, red grapes, sweet apple, very pleasant.  Sweet fruit hits the palate first followed up by some subdued grain, rich caramel and some dough and vanilla, not bad.  Thin to medium body with light carb.  A very pleasing pilsener.
UPDATED: NOV 6, 2007 Nice bottle! Good golden color with a frothy head, and nose of wheat and grass. Taste is full of grain and hops, with a long finish. Too much grain here for me.

(draft @ The Old Toad - Rochester, NY) Cloudy orange color with a thick and puffy tan head. The aroma smells like burnt plastic thats been cooled off and put in coffee can. Way too dry and bitter. Flavor is exactly the same. Way too dry and extremely bitter. Flavor clings and doesnt go away. Absolutely disgusting.

12oz (or thereabouts) bottle purchased from LCBO in Toronto.  Pours a slightly cloudy blonde with little lacing.  Aroma is decent.  The initial flavour is a solid lager with the good hops and with a very nice aftertaste that fills the mouth.  This one was pretty nice.

330ml Bottle. Love this beer. Pours very golden with a great frothy head and high carbination. Aroma is a nice blanace of citrus and malts with grassy notes. Flavour is initially very hoppy and bitter with a slightly sweet finish. The weight of this beer in the mouth is much fuller than one would expect from the style of beer. Brilliant. The only down side is that the batches can be slightly inconsistent, with the odd bottle tasting over hopped.

Pours a hazy brown-orange with a small white head that doesnt really lace.

The aroma is celery, brown sugar, and a lot of peach.

The mouthfeel is slightly creamy, with low-medium carbonation.

The taste is quite hoppy with a big bitter bite, some astringent aspirin, burnt cookies, and grapefruit.  The slightly higher alcohol content lends some warming to it, but it is not otherwise discernible.

All in all, a pretty good beer.  Id purchase this again happily.

The best pilsner Ive tasted so far. Pours a golden yellow with a thick froathy head that has good retention. Floral aroma with big notes of oats and malts.  Well balanced flavours of hops and malts, with some grains upfront, honey sweetness in the middle and hoppy piney bitterness in the finish. Medium Bodied, Dry finish, a rather strange pilsner but top notch all around.

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2010 swingtop bottle. poured hazy golden with a good sized white head that leaves nice lacings. yeasty aromas with hops also in the nose. flavours are really hoppy with a very bitter finish. very nice beer all around. i could drink boatloads.

Date: 03/05/1998
Mode: Draft
Source: Taco Mac, Sandy Springs

hazy yellow, thin head, bright hop aroma, light body, crisp hop flavor, citrus tartness, lots of lingering bitterness, deceptivaly light for the hop punch, tonge shaver
